greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First row of Pascal's triangle that has n distinct nonsquarefree entries, or -1 if no such row exists.
comment: Numbers such that a(n) is -1: 17, 20, 22, 34, 44, 51, ... - _Michel Marcus_, Mar 05 2014
mathematica: f[ n_ ] := (c = 0; k = 1; While[ k < n/2 + .5, If[ Union[ Transpose[ FactorInteger[ Binomial[ n, k ] ] ] [ [ 2 ] ] ] [ [ -1 ] ] > 1, c++ ]; k++ ]; c); Do[ m = 2; While[ f[ m ] != n, m++ ]; Print[ m ], {n, 0, 16} ]
program: (PARI) a(n, v) = {for (i=1, #v, if (v[i] == n, return (i-1));); return (-1);} \\ where v is vector A064460; _Michel Marcus_, Mar 05 2014
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 02 2001
ext: Corrected and extended by _Michel Marcus_, Mar 05 2014
